Covid Positive, What Now?
Rahul's COVID Journey: Chapter 2

Rajeev learns from his uncle that Rahul has been tested positive for COVID after having mild symptoms of slight fever and body aches. Rajeev decides to talk to home-isolated Rahul and mentally support him in his tough times. Let’s delve into their conversation.

Rajeev: Hey Rahul, just came to know about you being tested positive. How are you doing today? 

Rahul: Hello, thanks for your concern. I am doing just the same today, with moderate symptoms and complete lack of taste and smell. 

Rajeev: How much fever are you having currently? 

Rahul: I had around 101 fever this morning, so took a paracetamol post breakfast. Other than that, I am having mild cold and cough, and a sore throat. 

Rajeev: Your voice also sounds quite tired, please take all the medications on time and maintain complete bed rest! 

Rahul: But I am feeling low. I have made all my family vulnerable to the disease. I am feeling very unhappy. What should I so that I do not spread this disease to anyone else? 

Rajeev: Firstly, calm down. You are over-thinking. If you take all the precautionary measures, you won’t spread the virus to anyone else in the family. I hope you have completely isolated yourself in your house. 

Rahul: Oh yes. I am using a separate room and washroom. Papa has kept all my medicines by my bed which will last for at least 21days. I also have a timetable on when and how to intake these. Maa comes and keeps the food on a distant table and I take the plate from there. I sanitise my room thrice a day, and Dadi is never allowed to come near my room. I also keep sanitizing my hand as many times as possible, and incase I sneeze or cough, I use towels to clean myself with. These are all the precautions taken by us so far. 

Rajeev: Great! You have really become quite responsible. Also make sure to keep your masks on even inside the house.  

Rahul: What? But why! Why should we use masks inside our house?  

Rajeev: You, along with your family, must use masks even inside the house because while using a mask, prevent yourself from spreading the virus. I know it may get quite uncomfortable, but after all it’s just a matter of a few days. Prevention is better than cure. You can prevent any other member of your family from getting infected this way. 

Rahul: Thank you for the suggestion! We will surely take care of it. But what should I do for this lack of taste and smell I am having right now? I feel so numb. 

Rajeev: Oh you can’t do anything about it! The lack of taste and smell is a side-effect of this virus. But you can always work on bringing back your senses as soon as possible by intaking the “home made karha” twice a day. Scientists have actually confirmed that “Karha” has immune-boosting effects and the property to clean your body.  

Rahul: I’ve heard that obesity is a major risk factor for COVID-19. Is it true? 

Raajeev: Yes it is. You can know more here.

Rajeev: You’ll have to boost your immunity in order to stay strong, and for that – a healthy diet with lots of fruits, vegetables and protein is completely necessary. Also, drink atleast 2-3L of water every day to flush out any impurity from your body. Regarding medicines, never miss one, most of your medicines are vitamin supplements, zinc supplements and immunisers; which are necessary to your body in this phase. 

Rahul: Sure, I’ll keep all your advices in mind. One more thing, please tell me what to do in this isolation time. Sometimes I feel that I won’t be able to fight this virus.

Rajeev: Why are you feeling that you won’t be able to fight the virus? And you are on the correct medication and precautionary measures. You’ll obviously hail on.
And for your boredom in isolation, why don’t you try these out.

Rahul: Thank you for helping me out and supporting me like this in this tough time.  

Rajeev: Take good
care of yourself, and keep resting, since you’ll have to defeat that virus out
there, right? Don’t worry, you’ll be fine. 

Rahul: Yes, I will. And we all will fight this virus away from our country.
